creator: serle@creator.co.za
text:
When trying to read from the InputStream returned by HttpRequest.getInputStream
(), we are getting a SocketExeption: connection reset by peer: JVM_RECV in 
socket stream. This seems to happen more frequently over slower dial-up 
connections or when the server is loaded. It occurs from both browser and 
URLConnection client code. We are useing JDK1.3. I am not sure if this is a JVM 
problem or if this is a problem with Tomcat 4.0.

That exception should be raised by the tcp layer if the client disconnects.
Which connector are you using ?
- HTTP/1.1 standalone
- HTTP/1.0 standalone
- mod_webapp + Apache 1.3

No further information provided, so cannot do anything.  Appears to be a normal
result of client resetting the connection, rather than a bug.
